messages.content: I'm looking for a bike that can do 15 miles each way, with long, steady inclines and one short, steep climb near the end. I don't want to worry about daily charging — I ride five days a week and often run errands afterward. On weekends you take the same bike onto gravel greenways and sandy trails that get soft and slushy once winter hits. I want something that keeps a steady, natural pace on flats and gives smooth support into headwinds or up grades, without the jerky feel of older on/off assist systems. Braking should stay strong and predictable even when it’s wet. I often finish rides at dusk on unlit paths, so bright built-in lights that help me stay visible and move around the bike are a real plus. Comfort matters on longer rides, but I don’t need a downhill tank — just a capable, dependable bike that handles both my weekday commute andmy weekend detours
Thanks for sharing all those details! To help me find the best bike for you, could you please pick one or two preferences that matter most? For example, is battery life or comfort your top priority?
battery life, power and comfort, built-in-lights, no downhill tank.
